SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw.gc19
Package it.polimi.ingsw.gc19.View.ClientController

Class ClientState

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.gc19.View.ClientController.ClientState
Direct Known Subclasses:
Disconnect, End, NotGame, NotPlayer, OtherTurn, Pause, Pick, Place, Setup, Wait
public abstract class ClientState extends Object
This is an abstract class to represent the states of the Client in each moment of the game. From the creation of the player, to the creation of the game, to the various states of the game and the pause or disconnect phases.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    protected ClientController
    clientController
    Instance of the class used to forward the actions given by the user through commands to the client network interface.
    protected ClientInterface
    clientInterface
    Interface of a generic client that can be extended to handle connections (TCP or RMI), connection from configuration files and send commands.
    protected ListenersManager
    listenersManager
    Attribute used to attach the listeners that listen and notify of changes, events or errors generated during the game.

  • Method Details

    • nextState

      public void nextState(MessageToClient message)
      Generic message that doesn't change the state of the client. If everything works currently the client should not receive those kinds of messages. Even if those messages are received they do not change the state.
      Parameters:
      message - a generic MessageToClient.

    • nextState

      public void nextState(OwnAcceptedPickCardFromDeckMessage message)
      Change to the state after a OwnAcceptedPickCardFromDeckMessage arrived. Used to notify the client that a message containing a description of a pick from the deck arrived.
      Parameters:
      message - a OwnAcceptedPickCardFromDeckMessage message with the content of the latest pick action.

      Parameters:

    • nextState

      public void nextState(GameHandlingErrorMessage message)
      To update the client after a GameHandlingErrorMessage is arrived. The client should return from the WAIT to its previously state.
      Parameters:
      message - a GameHandlingErrorMessage from the server.

    • nextState

      public void nextState(NetworkHandlingErrorMessage message)
      To update the client state after a network error happened.
      Parameters:
      message - a NetworkHandlingErrorMessage

    • nextState

      public void nextState(RefusedActionMessage message)
      To update the client state after an action previously sent was refused. Notify the view too.
      Parameters:
      message - a RefusedActionMessage

    • nextState

      public void nextState(GameConfigurationMessage message)
      To update the client state after the server sent the configuration of the game. Notify the view too.
      Parameters:
      message - a GameConfigurationMessage

    • handleTurnStateAndFirstPlayer

      private void handleTurnStateAndFirstPlayer(String activePlayer, String nickname, TurnState turnState)
      Handles a TurnStateMessage and first player. For example, if activePlayer is the user, then it sets current state in ClientController to ViewState.PICK ot ViewState.PLACE
      Parameters:
      activePlayer - the nickname of the player in turn
      nickname - the nickname of the user
      turnState - the TurnState

    • nextState

      public void nextState(AvailableGamesMessage message)
      To update the view after a message containing the available games in the lobby was received from the server.
      Parameters:
      message - an AvailableGamesMessage send by the server.

    • nextState

      public void nextState(OwnStationConfigurationMessage message)
      To update the view and the ViewState of ClientController after a message with the configuration of the client's station has arrived after the server sent it.
      Parameters:
      message - an OwnStationConfigurationMessage

    • getState

      abstract ViewState getState()
      To return the state of the client, an element of class ViewState
      Returns:
      the current ViewState of the client.
